p: Even though little is known on HPV genotypes circulating among HIV-infected women in SSA countries, recommendations for HPV vaccination in the population of people living with HIV (PLHIV) are still unclear [ 7]. Of note, Generally 66% of infections are cleared at 12 months and this increases to 90% at 24 months [ 8]. For 10% of HPV-infected individuals, there is viral persistence that remains at latency. In this frame, immunodeficiency may be the cause of viral persistence and reactivation subsequently [ 7, 9].
